question: Question_08_(d)
statement:
Consider the 2 x 2 system of differential equations

\[\mathbf{x}'(t)=\begin{bmatrix}
-1  &  -2\\
2  &  -1
\end{bmatrix} \mathbf{x}(t)\]

where $\mathbf{x}(t)=\begin{bmatrix}x_1(t)\\x_2(t)\end{bmatrix}$ is the
vector of unknown functions.

Describe the trend of the solution as $t\to\infty$.
sols:
Since $\displaystyle e^{-t}$ goes to 0 as
$\displaystyle t \rightarrow \infty$, the solution goes to 0 as well.
hints:
Apply the limit $t \rightarrow \infty$ to your solution from part
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH152/April_2012/Question_08_(c)}{(c)}.
